components.content:
We welcome your views on the registration service.

If you agree to be contacted by answering 'yes' below, you will be consenting to share your personal data – name, email address, telephone number and service received – with our independent partner research agency, IFF research.

You may withdraw your consent at any stage by email Consular.research@fco.gov.uk.

For more details on how your data will be handled in relation to feedback please see the research privacy policy at www.gov.uk/fco/tell-fco.

pages.title: How do you prefer to be contacted?

components.name: PreferContacted
components.title: How do you prefer to be contacted?

components.content: If you’re a British national getting a marriage or civil partnership abroad, you might need certain documents from the UK government, for example a certificate of no impediment (CNI).
Use this tool to find out how to get the documents you’ll need.
You’ll need to contact the local authorities where you want to get married to find out what you need to do.
Your marriage or civil partnership will be recognised in the UK if both of the following apply:

• you followed the correct process in the country where you got married
  • it would be allowed under UK law
There’s a separate guide if you want to get married or enter into a civil partnership in the UK.

components.name: countryPicker
components.title: Where do you want to get married?

pages.title: What type of ceremony are you planning?

components.name: ceremony
components.title: What type of ceremony are you planning?

components.content: ! Warning Before you get married contact the civil registry office where you're planning to get married to find out what documents you need. Apply for all your certificates at least 3 months before you take your documents to the civil registry appointment.

The civil registry office will ask for one or both of the following:

  • Certificate of no impediment
  • Marital status certificate
You may want to print out both sample forms and take them with you when you first visit the civil registry office. They will then tell you which forms you need.

If your partner is British they’ll need to make a separate application to the consulate with the same certificates. If they’re not British they’ll need equivalent documents from their local authorities.
Add a photo of the main page of your British passport – the page with the passport photo.

  • Use both hands to keep your phone steady.

components.content:
Either take photos or scan the following documents:

  • UK passport
  • partner's passport
  • long birth certificate
  • town hall registration certificate (Certificado de Empadronamiento), needs to be issued at least 3 working days before

    or

    Spanish residence certificate (green card with NIE number and address)

You'll also need to upload one of the following:

  • decree absolute
  • final order
  • death certificate of your late partner
  • certificate of nullity

  • Position the phone parallel to the document.
  • Use both hands to keep your phone steady.
Add a photo of your long British birth certificate. The full version of the certificate shows the names of your parents.

components.name: needMSC

pages.title: Apply for the certificate of no impediment and marital status certificate

components.content:
To get married in Spain you need to get a certificate of no impediment and a marital status certificate.

A certificate of no impediment:

  • costs £50
  • takes 28 days to process
  • is valid for 6 months

A marital status certificate:

  • costs £50
  • takes 30 days to process

Apply for all your certificates at least 3 months before you take your documents to the civil registry appointment.

Have the following documents ready:

  • name of authority in Spain (civil registry, court etc.) requesting the certificate from the British Consulate
  • date of appointment to submit paperwork to the authority in Spain. (approximate date)
  • date and place of the ceremony

components.content:
Before you apply online for a certificate of no imediment and marital status certificate you need to:

  1. Download and complete a notice of marriage (Publicación de Edictos) and a certificate of no impediment affirmation (Declaración Solemne)
  2. Download and complete a marital status affirmation (Declaración Solemne)

You'll need to sign and swear the affirmations and notice of marriage in front of a local notary in Spain.

pages.title: Find out if you need a certificate of no impediment

components.content:
You need to visit the civil registry office where you're planning to get married to find out which documents you need before you can apply.

Without doing this, you risk applying and paying for a certificate you don't need.

pages.title: Find out if you need a marital status certificate

components.content:
You need to visit the civil registry office where you're planning to get married to find out which documents you need before you can apply.

Without doing this, you risk applying and paying for a certificate you don't need.

Before you apply online for a certificate of no impediment and marital status certificate you need to:

  1. Download and complete a certificate of no impediment affirmation (Declaración Solemne)
  2. Download and complete the marital status affirmation (Declaración Solemne)
  3. Get a notice of marriage from a registry office in the UK

components.title: How to get a notice of marriage?
components.content: text to come
You'll need to sign and swear the affirmations in front of a local notary in Spain.

pages.title: Civil partnership is not recognised in Spain

components.content: You won't be able to plan your civil partnership ceremony in Spain.

Before you apply online for a certificate of no impediment you need to:

  • Download and complete a notice of marriage (Publicación de Edictos) and a certificate of no impediment affirmation (Declaración Solemne)

You'll need to sign and swear the affirmation and notice of marriage in front of a local notary in Spain.

Before you apply online for a marital status certificate you need to:

  • Download and complete a marital status affirmation (Declaración Solemne)

You'll need to sign and swear the affirmation in front of a local notary in Spain.
Before you apply online for a marital status certificate you need to:
1. Get a notice of marriage from a registry office in the UK

components.content: 2. Download a marital status affirmation (Declaración Solemne)
You'll need to sign and swear the affirmation in front of a local notary in Spain.

pages.title: Apply for the certificate of no impediment

components.content:
To get married in Spain you need to get a certificate of no impediment.

A certificate of no impediment:

  • costs £50
  • takes 28 days to process
  • is valid for 6 months

Apply for your certificate at least 3 months before you take your document to the civil registry appointment.

pages.title: Apply for the marital status certificate

components.content:
To get married in Spain you need to get a marital status certificate.

A marital status certificate:

  • costs £50
  • takes 30 days to process

Apply for your certificate at least 3 months before you take your document to the civil registry appointment.
Before you apply online for a certificate of no impediment you need to:
1. Get a notice of marriage from a registry office in the UK

components.title: Which documents can be used as proof of address?
components.content:
• electoral role confirmation letter
  • utility bills (not printed off the internet) / building society/savings bank passbook
  • bank/building society/credit card statement (not ones printed off the internet)
  • mortgage statement /council tax demand / credit reference agency search
  • recent evidence of entitlement to state or local authority-funded benefit, tax credit, pension, educational or other grant
components.name: /local-deed-docs-539-539

components.content:
You'll also need to upload one of the following:

  • partner's decree absolute
  • partner's final order
  • death certificate of your partner's late partner
  • partner's certificate of nullity

components.title: How to take a good photograph
components.content:
• Lay it flat on a table or for better results against a wall.
  • Make sure your address is readable.
  • No flash if possible.
  • Position the phone parallel to the document.
  • Use both hands to keep your phone steady.

components.title: Which documents can be used as proof of address?
components.content:
• electoral role confirmation letter
  • utility bills (not printed off the internet) / building society/savings bank passbook
  • bank/building society/credit card statement (not ones printed off the internet)
  • mortgage statement /council tax demand / credit reference agency search
  • recent evidence of entitlement to state or local authority-funded benefit, tax credit, pension, educational or other grant
components.name: /need-to-apply-Spain-CNI-married-287-287

components.content:
You'll also need to upload one of the following:

  • decree absolute
  • final order
  • death certificate of your late partner
  • certificate of nullity
components.name: /need-to-apply-Spain-CNI-married-287-287

components.content:
And you'll need to upload one of the following:

  • partner's decree absolute
  • partner's final order
  • death certificate of your partner's late partner
  • partner's certificate of nullity

components.title: How to take a good photograph
components.content:
• Lay it flat on a table or for better results against a wall.
  • Make sure your address is readable.
  • No flash if possible.
  • Position the phone parallel to the document.
  • Use both hands to keep your phone steady.
components.name: /need-to-apply-Spain-CNI-married-287-287

components.content:
Either take photos or scan the following documents:

  • your UK passport
  • your partner's passport
  • long birth certificate
  • proof that you have been in Spain for at least 3 full days immediately before signing your Notice of Marriage and affirmation in front of a notary (e.g. copy of flight information and boarding pass)
  • proof of the address where you are staying in Spain

You'll also need to upload one of the following:

  • decree absolute
  • final order
  • death certificate of your late partner
  • certificate of nullity

lists.name: Country
lists.title: Where do you want to get married

items.description: France
Spain
Thailand

lists.name: UploadOptions
lists.title: How would you like to provide the documents?

lists.name: deliveryAddress
lists.title: Where would you like your certificate delivered to?

items.text: Give notice of marriage at your local registry office in the UK
items.description: A notice of marriage takes between 28 and 29 days in the UK. You will need this document for your Spanish certificate of no impediment

items.text: Get your affirmation(s) notarised by a notary in Spain
items.description: You have to swear an affirmation in front of a notary. You will need this document for your marital status certificate
Upload a photo or scan of your documents
Take as long as you need to finish, but if you're inactive for more than 20 minutes your application will time out
By credit or debit card
We'll tell you where to send the documents

lists.name: Documents
lists.title: What documents do you have that prove you're a British citizen?

items.text: Your local birth certificate, your parent's British birth certificate and your parent's marriage certificate (if applicable)
items.value: Local birth certificate, you're parent's British birth certificate and your parent's marriage certificate (if applicable)

items.text: Your Home Office Certificate of Naturalisation or Registration
items.value: Home Office Certificate of Naturalisation or Registration

lists.name: whereShouldWeSendCertificate
lists.title: Where should we send the certificate

items.text: Give notice of marriage at your local registry office in the UK
items.value: Give notice of marriage at your local registry office in the UK
items.description: A notice of marriage takes between 28 and 29 days in the UK. You will need this document for your Spanish certificate of no impediment

items.text: Get your affirmation notarised by a notary in Spain
items.value: Get your affirmation notarised by a notary in Spain
items.description: You have  to swear an affirmation in front of a notary. You will need this document for your marital status certificate

items.text: Apply for the certificate of no impediment and marital status certificate
items.value: Apply for the certificate of no impediment and marital status certificate
items.description: Apply online here
This includes the originals of your notice of marriage, your affirmation, and, in case you are divorced or widowed, your decree absolute or death certificate of your late partner

items.text: Book appointment at a Spanish registry office
items.value: Book appointment at a Spanish registry office

items.text: Get your notice of marriage and affirmation(s) notarised by a notary in Spain
items.description: You have to swear an affirmation in front of a notary.
Upload a photo or scan of your documents
Take as long as you need to finish, but if you're inactive for more than 20 minutes your application will time out
By credit or debit card
We'll tell you where to send the documents

items.text: Get your affirmation notarised by a notary in Spain
items.description: You have to swear an affirmation in front of a notary.
Upload a photo or scan of your documents
Take as long as you need to finish, but if you're inactive for more than 20 minutes your application will time out
By credit or debit card
